image.altText: A CCTV still shows perpetrator walking and holding what police allege is a knife.

props.synopsis: The father, mother and brother of a woman who was the victim of an "honour" stabbing in Adelaide's north have had their sentences reduced.

title.children: Sentences reduced for family members convicted over 'honour' stabbing

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing a check shirt, standing in front of a sign that says Golden North Ice Cream

props.synopsis: Locals say Golden North and the SA town of Laura are synonymous with each other, but the ice cream manufacturer is set to close its local factory.

title.children: SA town shocked at Golden North ice cream's exit

image.altText: hand-knitted teddy bears piled on a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Willy Weidenhofer's hand-knitted trauma teddies have been handed out to hundreds of children in ambulances or the emergency department during a trip to the local hospital.

title.children: Hundreds of handmade 'trauma teddies' comfort young patients

image.altText: A man wearing a police uniform.

props.synopsis: A newspaper article published this week reported a "high-ranking" SA police officer had accidentally fired their gun while attending a house in suburban Adelaide during the 1990s. Here's how the commissioner responded.

title.children: SA's police chief has opened up about a 1991 firearm incident — here's what was said

image.altText: Phil Walsh smiles while speaking to the media

props.synopsis: When Crows supporters awoke on the morning of July 3, 2015 to the news that their club's coach had been fatally stabbed in his own home at Somerton Park, the shock and anguish were both immediate and palpable.

title.children: Phil Walsh's death a decade ago united footy fans divided by their Showdown

image.altText: A fiddler ray with reddish tinges

props.synopsis: Dozens of sharks and rays collected from Adelaide beaches will be studied to find out how they were killed by the algal bloom amid fears of future local extinctions.

title.children: Adelaide residents rally to collect deluge of dead marine life from algal bloom

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Reforms that would standardise Working with Children Checks across the country "can't happen soon enough", the federal education minister says, in the wake of allegations of child sexual abuse at a Victorian childcare centre.

title.children: 'It's taken too long': Minister criticises Working with Children Check reforms

image.altText: A large body of blue water within a reservior

props.synopsis: SA Water is facing a criminal penalty for causing "serious environmental harm" when an engineer ignored a water quality test result while draining a Barossa Valley reservoir for maintenance work, a court has heard.

title.children: SA Water to face penalty over botched reservoir draining

image.altText: A chicken in the arms of a girl.

props.synopsis: The price of eggs is pushing people towards backyard chickens and the poultry showing community hopes it will revive the hobby.

title.children: Feather fanciers bid for birds as hopes rise for poultry hobby resurgence

image.altText: A girl smiling in a school photo

props.synopsis: The family of an Adelaide mother and daughter who disappeared 25 years ago is calling for people with information to contact police.

title.children: 'The damage is done': Family pleads for info in mother and daughter cold case

image.altText: Frank Pangallo in a white shirt with Opposition leader Vincent Tarzia in a composite image

props.synopsis: Attracting high-quality candidates to run for public office can be a challenge at the best of times, let alone when there are signs of political doom on the horizon.

title.children: As the 2026 state election nears, who will run for the SA Liberal Party?

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Critics have accused South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas of "shafting" Adelaide City Council after the government legislated to take over the city's urban golf course

title.children: 'Keeps the plebs happy': SA premier at centre of golf controversy

image.altText: Two people stand on a boardwalk overlooking a long blue beach

props.synopsis: Despite house prices nearly doubling in the last five years, regional South Australia is still a buyer's market, according to fresh research.

title.children: Regional SA homes among country's most affordable even as prices soar

image.altText: A person wearing an orange uniform and vest leans out of a boat with a device looking into the sea

props.synopsis: Police investigators will review a "significant amount" of CCTV footage before resuming a search for the remains of alleged Port Lincoln murder victim Julian Story.

title.children: 'Intensive' search paused for remains of alleged Port Lincoln murder victim

image.altText: Daryl Mundy

props.synopsis: A South Australian police sergeant of "exceptional character" has been handed a $2,000 fine for failing to stop after getting in a "minor collision" in the Adelaide CBD.

title.children: SA Police officer handed fine for 'minor' CBD collision

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: A disability carer, who has pleaded guilty to causing a crash which killed her patient, suffers from 'survivor guilt' and 'doesn't sleep at night', a court has heard.

title.children: Disability carer 'misjudged' turn before causing crash that killed her client, court hears

image.altText: On stage, David Campbell, a 51-year-old man in a suit, smiles as he sings, clicking his fingers, a band behind him.

props.synopsis: David Campbell, Virginia Gay, Natalie Abbott and Victoria Falconer are stars of Australian cabaret. They share what they love about the art form and how they got started.

title.children: David Campbell was a cabaret upstart in the 90s. Now he inspires others

image.altText: A woman with brown wavy hair is wearing a black blazer and sitting in an office

props.synopsis: The final report by Australia's first truth-telling commission was tabled in parliament this week. What does this mean for Australia, and will it lead to change?

title.children: Calls for healing and acknowledgement as Yoorrook lays bare a brutal past

image.altText: Iranian president stands at a podium in front of an Iranian flag. He has short white hair.

props.synopsis: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has ordered the country to suspend its cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency after US and Israeli air strikes hit its key nuclear facilities.

title.children: Iran suspends cooperation with UN nuclear watchdog

image.altText: The top of UTS Tower visible over red corrugated rooves of a warehouse.

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney is being investigated by SafeWork over "psychological hazards" arising from a restructure with other universities also wielding the axe.

title.children: 'Helplessness': UTS staff risk jobs to raise concerns over $100m restructure

image.altText: man with shaves head, orange and red robes sits on chat with woman with red and white hat waving arms.

props.synopsis: The Dalai Lama confirms his centuries-old tradition will continue, with his charitable foundation the only authority to recognise his future reincarnation.

title.children: Dalai Lama affirms succession plan for after his death, heartening supporters

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks to the media, Friday, June 27, 2025, in the briefing room of the White House in Washington.

props.synopsis: Media group Paramount will pay Donald Trump more than $24 million to settle a lawsuit filed over an interview with former US presidential rival Kamala Harris.

title.children: Paramount to pay Trump $24m over Harris interview lawsuit

image.altText: People recline on marble steps outside the US Captiol. The building's domed roof can be seen in the bakground

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is getting closer to seeing his One Big Beautiful Bill Act passed after it narrowly passed a Senate vote. Here's why the bill isn't enjoying full Republican support.

title.children: Why Republicans are voting against Trump's Big Beautiful Bill

image.altText: Elliot Daly of the Lions is seen being treated for an injury by two medics, holding his left forearm

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions have continued their roaring start to the Australian tour, defeating the Queensland Reds 52-12.

title.children: Lions win soured as versatile fullback suffers suspected fractured arm

image.altText: Ye wears a black tee and jeans, Censori wears a black fur coat

props.synopsis: The musician had a valid visa cancelled by officials in Tony Burke's department after he released a song titled Heil Hitler.

title.children: Minister reveals Kanye West was denied entry to Australia

image.altText: a boy pours water over his head during a heatwave at the spanish steps in Rome

props.synopsis: Four people have died in Spain, two in France and two in Italy as an early summer heatwave continues to grip much of Europe.

title.children: At least eight dead as heatwave in Europe closes nuclear reactor and fans fires

image.altText: Close up of man wearing glasses

props.synopsis: Joshua Maxwell was told his open-heart surgery had to be done within 90 days. He thought he was going to die as the wait extended beyond 200 days.

title.children: Joshua waited over 200 days for life-saving surgery at troubled hospital

image.altText: Researcher in scuba diving suit underwater conducting sampling on the reef

props.synopsis: A University of Queensland study has found the further coral disperses, the better chance reefs have at bouncing back from disaster.

title.children: Research shows coral larvae could be 'key' to restoring damaged reefs

image.altText: Tiered brick pyramid in sandy desert with line of people walking up to it.

props.synopsis: Researchers have sequenced the genome of an ancient Egyptian who was buried in a pot nearly 5,000 years ago, about the time some of the oldest, and most famous, pyramids were built.

title.children: DNA from skeleton in a pot reveals ancient Egyptian's ancestry

image.altText: Servicemen from the mobile air defence unit of the 115th Separate Mechanized Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces firing weapon

props.synopsis: Ukraine is appealing to the US envoy in Kyiv after Washington halts some shipments of critical weapons to the war-ravaged country.

title.children: Ukraine warns cutting off US weapons shipments will 'only encourage Russia'

image.altText: A man standing in front of a blue painting smiles gently

props.synopsis: After controversially and suddenly withdrawing Khaled Sabsabi and Michael Dagostino from the 2026 Venice Biennale, Creative Australia has announced it has reversed its decision.

title.children: Khaled Sabsabi reinstated as Australia's representative at 2026 Venice Biennale

image.altText: A photo of the painting The Birth of Venus being taken on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: Smart devices are becoming more sophisticated and we're increasingly using them to document our lives in minute detail. But research suggests this is changing the way we think — and remember.

title.children: Storing your life on your phone changes the way you think

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Police are examining whether the former nurse may have committed other crimes at hospitals where she worked.

title.children: Prosecutors consider further charges against killer nurse Lucy Letby

image.altText: Participants raise a rainbow flag, a symbol of the gay rights movement during the annual Gay Pride Parade in Hong Kong

props.synopsis: Hong Kong's government has proposed a new system to give same-sex couples a limited set of healthcare-related rights as long as their marriages are registered abroad.

title.children: Hong Kong proposes recognising same-sex partnerships formed overseas

image.altText: A traditional-looking housewife smiles at the camera as she holds a pie standing in a pink-coloured pantry

props.synopsis: What is it about the tradwife movement and its strict traditional gender roles that has struck a chord with modern day mothers?

title.children: These modern stay-at-home mums are redefining what it means to be a tradwife
